Context: The Early Childhood Education program at George Brown College is a two-year diploma program that teaches students how to support the holistic development of children from six weeks to 12 years of age in various settings. Domestic students starting in September 2023 and January 2024 may be eligible for a $2,000 tuition grant. The program consists of in-class learning and field placement to help students develop confidence in their skills. An accelerated option (C160) and fast-track option (C130) are also available for those who wish to enter the field quickly. Students will complete a seven-week field placement in each semester, providing opportunities to work with children of different age groups in various settings. The program is funded by the City of Toronto, the Region of Durham, the Region of Peel, the Province of Ontario, and the Government of Canada under the Canada-Ontario Early Childhood Workforce Agreement.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2023/Early Childhood Education Program C100 | George Brown College2023.txt

Context:
The text is about the Early Childhood Education program offered by the college. The program aims to provide students with opportunities to integrate theory and practice, and exposes them to various environments through Ontario's largest network of college-run lab school child care centres. There are 12 child care centres located across the Greater Toronto Area (GTA), serving over 1100 children and their families each year.

Graduates of the program may find employment in various settings such as child care centres, early years centres, full-day kindergarten, parent resource centres, pediatric playrooms, special education settings, integrated kindergartens, therapeutic nursery programs, and in-home care. Successful completion of the program makes students eligible for entrance to Ontario's College of Early Childhood Educators as a Registered Early Childhood Educator.

Students who complete the program with a GPA of 2.5 or higher may apply to complete the bridge courses for entry into the third year of George Brown's Honours Bachelor of Early Childhood Leadership (Degree Completion) program. The required courses for Semester 1 include ECE 1000, ECE 1075, ECE 1069, ECE 1070, ECE 1076, and ECE 2045, along with PSY 1075.

It is important to note that some field placement partners may require students to show proof of full vaccination against COVID-19, and students who are not fully vaccinated may not be able to complete the required field placement component of their program in the regularly scheduled time frame. For more information on future study options, see the Transfer Guide.

Context:
The text provides information about the roles and responsibilities of Early Childhood Educators in co-creating and facilitating early years programs, designing inclusive learning environments, collaborating with children, families, and communities, using observation strategies, acting in accordance with legislation and ethical standards, reporting child safety concerns, creating partnerships, and engaging in reflective practice. The text also includes details about tuition and fees for domestic and international students.

Context:
Programs starting in Fall 2023 with OSAP funding eligibility for eligible applicants. Fees are subject to change for programs starting in Fall 2024 and at later dates.

Admission Requirements:
- Ontario Secondary School Diploma or equivalent
- grade 12 English (C or U)
- any additional 3 grade 12 C, U, M or grade 11 C, U or M credits (excluding grade 11 English)
- Mature students may take the Admissions Assessment for English or upgrade to achieve required credits in English
- Meeting minimum requirements does not guarantee admission to the program

Course Exemptions:
- College or university credits may qualify for course exemptions

International Students:
- Visit International Fees and Related Costs page for more information
- Visit International Admissions page for country-specific admission requirements

Special Requirements:
- Field placement is mandatory and complex component of the program
- All students must complete the following prior to beginning field placement:
  - standard First Aid with CPR level C course
  - Police Vulnerable Sector Check
  - medical clearance

Disclaimer: Information contained in this website is subject to change without notice. Students are responsible for verifying George Brown College fee requirements and admission requirements.
